title: EC orders investigation over Disneyland Paris pricing
text:
EC orders investigation over Disneyland Paris pricing 29 July 2015 Save 
The European Commission (EC) has ordered an investigation into Disneyland Paris amid claims that British tourists are paying chargers up to 40% dearer than the French. 
It said the French are currently being charged £954 for a premium package, less than the £1,325 charged in the UK and considerably less than the £1,734 fee charged in Germany. 
Brits are also charged about 15% more for one-day tickets than the French with Disnelyand Paris defending the difference by arguing they are subject to booking patterns and school holidays. 
However, the EC has found other theme parks, including Legoland in Denmark, do not have such varied difference. 
EU commissioner for the single market Elzbieta Bienkowska said: “I am interested in answers and explanations. 
“On the face of it I struggle to see what objective justification there could be for these practices.” 
If France refuses to act against the theme park, the EC can take the country to court. Readers' comments (1) Michael Edwards | Wed, 29 Jul 2015 1:40 pm 
An interesting report , and hopefully will result in a fair cost for all and not in favour of the host country. Let's hope it doesn't take too long ....
